info.title: Offers API
info.description:
The Offers API provides flight schedules, fares and transfer information for KLM and Air France for
any bookable date in the future. This API enables you to find out all the options related to a passenger
journey including information on schedule, prices, taxes and surcharges, route information, alternative choices,
conditions, etc.

post.summary: Create a shopping cart for a quotation
post.description: Creates a shopping cart for a specific quotation to be able to proceed to checkout.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the API targeted.

parameters.name: d
parameters.description: The shopping cart request for a quotation

400.description: Bad request (validation failure, missing header, etc.)

post.summary: Provides the lowest fares by destinations
post.description: Provides the lowest fares by destinations on the next 12 months for a given origin.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the API targeted.

requestBody.description: The lowest fares per destination request.

400.description: Bad request (validation failure, missing header, etc.)

get.summary: Get a search context to retrieve an already stored profile
get.description: Provides the possibility to initialize a search context linked to the mashery context (authorization and login mode) and the input parameters. Only useful for corporate flow for the moment. Use case flow can then be followed by the consumer by requesting POST methods on availableOffers/lowestOffers with adding the profiled in the service URL.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the API targeted.

parameters.name: profileId
parameters.description: The id of the profile to retrieve.

parameters.name: reservationId
parameters.description: The id of the reservation, in case of rebooking.

parameters.name: contractNumber
parameters.description: The subscriber contract number, in case the user is logged with his contract.

400.description: Bad request (validation failure, missing header, etc.)

post.summary: Provides the details of the customer and flight to be sent by mail
post.description: Provides the information of the customer mail, name, and the details of the flight to be sent by mail. Use case flow can be followed by the consumer by requesting the POST method supplied as HATEOAS link in the response body of Upsell Offers.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the API targeted.

post.summary: Provides the availability on flights

post.summary: Create a shopping cart for a flight product
post.description: Creates a shopping cart for a specific flight product to be able to proceed to checkout. Use case flow can be followed by the consumer by requesting the POST method supplied as HATEOAS link in the response body of AvailableOffers & UpsellOffers.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the API targeted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The encoded id that contains both the flightProduct id and the search criteria to replay the request when the flight product is not found in the cache.

400.description: Bad request (validation failure, missing header, etc.)

post.summary: Create a shopping cart for a time to think flight product
post.description: Creates a shopping cart for a specific flight product to be able to proceed to checkout. Use case flow can be followed by the consumer by requesting the POST method supplied as HATEOAS link in the response body of AvailableOffers & UpsellOffers.

get.summary: Get lowest fare offers from hateoas link
get.description: Provides the available flight offers with the lowest fare based on a certain period (Overall, Months or Days). Use case flow can then be followed by the consumer by requesting the GET methods (for LowestFareOffers & AvailableOffers) supplied as HATEOAS link in the POST response body.

parameters.name: d
parameters.description: The lowest fare offers request

parameters.name: dateInterval
parameters.description: The expected date interval (overriding the one in the request)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The expected period of time to be considered when requesting lowest fares)

schema.description: The different periods of time that can be considered when requesting lowest fares.

parameters.name: commercialCabin
parameters.description: The expected commercial cabin (overriding the one in the request)

schema.description: Represents the possible commercial cabins, including the "ALL" option. Commercial cabins represent the different qualities of accomodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

parameters.name: displayPriceContent
parameters.description: The expected content in the displayPrice fields (overriding the one in the request)

schema.description: The different formats and content for the displayPrice value.

parameters.name: negotiatedFareOnly
parameters.description: The expected type of fare (negotiated only, or all) (overriding the one in the request)

400.description: Bad request (validation failure, missing header, etc.)

post.summary: Get lowest fare offers
post.description: Provides the available flight offers with the lowest fare based on a certain period (Overall, Months or Days). Use case flow can then be followed by the consumer by requesting the GET methods (for LowestFareOffers & AvailableOffers) supplied as HATEOAS link in the POST response body.

schema.description: Represents the possible commercial cabins, including the "ALL" option. Commercial cabins represent the different qualities of accomodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The flight product ID

400.description: Bad request (validation failure, missing header, etc.)

get.summary: Get the reference data for the best deals scope
get.description: Provides the reference data a consumer needs to support a customer to search for the deals. The reference data is typically requested at the start of the use case to know which data can be used in request.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the API targeted.

parameters.name: bookingFlow
parameters.description: The booking flow requested.

schema.description: Represents a type of booking flow, i.e. the specific context in which the customer is booking a flight (eg: for leisure, as a corporate, as a staff etc.).

400.description: Bad request (validation failure, missing header, etc.)

get.summary: Get related products from hateoas link
get.description: The /related-products endpoint provides the related products (currently only Time to Think) for a selected flight product. Use case flow can be followed by the consumer by requesting the GET method supplied as HATEOAS link in the response body of /available-offers & /upsell-offers.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The version of the API targeted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: An encoded "id" that contains both the flightProduct id and the search criteria to replay the request when the flight product is not found in the cache.

parameters.name: device
parameters.description: The device used to book the time to think.

400.description: Bad request (validation failure, missing header, etc.)

get.summary: Get ticket conditions for a reservation id from hateoas link
get.description: Provides the ticket conditions that match the fares of the provided reservationID parameters. It includes the number of FB miles that can be earned. Use case flow can be followed by the consumer by requesting the GET method supplied as HATEOAS link in the response body of Reservation API.

parameters.name: reservationId
parameters.description: The reservation id for which the ticket conditions are requested.

400.description: Bad request (validation failure, missing header, etc.)

get.summary: Get ticket conditions for a trip identifier from hateoas link
get.description: Provides the ticket conditions that match the provided query parameters. It includes the number of FB miles that can be earned. Use case flow can be followed by the consumer by requesting the GET method supplied as HATEOAS link in the response body of Order API.

parameters.name: tripIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the trip.

description.example: origin city must be different from destination city AND neither or both O&D can be null at the same time

errorInInputPath.description: The path to the input element that raised the error/warning.

errorInOutputPath.description: The path to the output element that raised the error/warning.

requestContextId.description: The id of the request to be able to find more elements in the logs about the incident.

items.description: The type of errors.

AbnormalResponseDescriptor.description: Represents the descriptor of a warning or error incident.

class.description: The cabin class code (eg: M, W, C etc.).

Cabin.description: The cabin class in which the passenger will travel on this segment. It represents the quality of accomodation & services the passenger will have access to in the airplane.

City.description: The location code of the station.

equipInformationText.description: An optional informative text about the equipment. Usually returned in case of specific equipments like trains, bus or limousines..
equipInformationText.example: Please note: you will travel by bus for this part of the journey.

acvCode.description: The ACV code of the equipment.

EquipmentType.description: Represents a type of equipment and the data related to it.

halfHourDelayPercentage.description: The percentage of flights having a delay of less than half an hour.

hourDelayPercentage.description: The percentage of flights having a delay of less than an hour.

FlightOnTime.description: Represents statistics about the on-time departure of flights. This information is specifically required in point of sale Brazil.

number.description: A four digit number representing the number of the flight.

suffix.description: A suffix to be appended at the end of the flight number, for example when a flight is canceled and rescheduled.

Money.description: The amount of the price item.

OperatingFlight.description: The operating flight, i.e. the flight actually carrying the passengers and operated by the operating airline/carrier.

id.description: The id identifying the passenger uniquely in the request.

pnrId.description: The id of the PNR (Passenger Name Record), identifying the reservation of the passenger. Only to be set in rebooking.

minAge.description: A lower bound for the age of the passenger (used to estimate the type of the passenger).

maxAge.description: An higher bound for the age of the passenger (used to estimate the type of the passenger).

ticketNumber.description: The ticket number of the passenger in the PNR. Only to be set in rebooking.

Passenger.description: The requested passenger of a flight.

label.description: The label describing the category.

totals.description: The total price amount for the category.

priceComponents.description: The different components of the price.

PriceCategory.description: Represents a category constituting a price.

code.description: The code of the price component.

label.description: The label of the price component.

currency.description: The currency of the price component.

priceComponentBreakdown.description: The amount of the price component.

PriceComponent.description: Represents the components of a price.

code.description: The code of the price item.

nature.description: The nature of the price item.

label.description: The label of the price item.

PriceComponentBreakdownItem.description: The breakdown of a price component.

priceCategories.description: The different categories constituting the price.

PriceDetails.description: Represents the price-details of a flight offer.

passengerId.description: The id of the passenger.

arrivalDateTime.description: The arrival date and time of the segment.

departureDateTime.description: The departure date and time of the segment.

stopsAt.description: The list of technical stops occurring on the segment. These stops are usually for refuelling purpose and passengers usually do not disembark the plane (as opposed to transfers).

stopInformationText.description: The label linked to the technical stop. This message is translated.
stopInformationText.example: Your Muscat - Amsterdam trip includes a stop in Dammam / Dhahran, Saudi Arabia. Please check the entry requirements for this country.

transferTime.description: The transfer time between the arrival of this segment and the departure of the next segment, can be null if there is no next segment.

transferLabel.description: The label linked to the transfer. This message is translated.
transferLabel.example: Your trip includes a transfer in Paris. Please note that you must collect any checked baggage from Paris Orly Airport before proceeding to Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport.

highestPriority.description: A flag indicating if this segment is the one of higher priority, in regard to its haul type.

dateVariation.description: The number of days between the dates of departure and arrival of the segment.

flightDuration.description: The duration of the flight in minutes on this segment.

overnightLabel.description: The label accompanying the overnight flag. The label is translated.
overnightLabel.example: Your Copenhagen - Lisbon trip includes a stop in Amsterdam which may require an overnight stay at your own expense. Please check the entry requirements for this country.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from an airline point of view.

operatingCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from the point of view of the operating carrier (example for a bus: the commercial cabin may be described as economy, whereas the operating cabin may be "Main cabin").

fareBasis.description: The fare basis associated to the segment.

sellingClass.description: The selling class code (also called booking class) of the segment.

baggageAllowancePerPassenger.description: The baggage allowances per passenger on the segment.

QuotationSegmentResponse.description: Represents the details of a segment.

level.description: The value of the rating value of the (eg: 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5 for a 5-stars rating).

count.description: The number of customers who gave this rating.

RatingCategory.description: The rating category. There is one category per possible rating value (5 categories, from 1 to 5 for a 5-stars rating).

ratingCategories.description: The amount of ratings per level. Starts with the 5 stars.

averageRating.description: The average rating given by the former passengers.

RatingStatistics.description: The rating given by former customers to a flight.

bookingFlow.description: Represents a type of booking flow, i.e. the specific context in which the customer is booking a flight (eg: for leisure, as a corporate, as a staff etc.).

ShoppingCartFromQuotationRequest.description: Represents the request to the shopping cart when coming from the quotation.

StaffInformation.description: The data related to the staff.

StationCity.description: Represents a station (city, stopover etc.) that can be used in an itinerary.

Stopover.description: The location code of the station.

currency.description: The currency of the price.

TotalAmount.description: Represents the total price of a flight offer.

id.description: The legacy id associated to the offer, usually corresponds to the resource store ID.

resourceId.description: The id of the offer in the resource store.

offerId.description: The id of the offer in the Create Offer.

shopCreated.description: A flag indicating if the offer was created in the CreateShop.

OfferIdentifiers.description: The value of the rating value of the (eg: 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5 for a 5-stars rating).

bookingFlow.description: Represents a type of booking flow, i.e. the specific context in which the customer is booking a flight (eg: for leisure, as a corporate, as a staff etc.).

destinationCities.description: The cities of destination of the fares to retrieve.

items.description: The cities of destination of the fares to retrieve.

type.description: The different periods of time that can be considered when requesting lowest fares.

fromDate.description: The start date time of the interval.

untilDate.description: The end date time of the interval.

LowestFaresByDestinationRequest.description: Represents a lowest fares by destination request.

DateInterval.description: Date interval describing the range of dates used when retrieving the fares related to this offer. It depends on the dateInterval asked in request.

displayPriceText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the price to display.
displayPriceText.example: All amounts are in EUR. Taxes and surcharges are included. No booking fee is applicable, but a payment surcharge may apply. Prices shown may vary depending on fare availability.

totalPriceText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the total price.
totalPriceText.example: All amounts are in EUR. Taxes and surcharges are included. No booking fee is applicable, but a payment surcharge may apply. Prices shown may vary depending on fare availability.

fareMilesText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the fare in miles.
fareMilesText.example: * Please note: airport taxes and security charges are not covered by your Miles and must be paid separately. The same applies for carrier-imposed surcharges. For flights within Europe operated by Air France, KLM, HOP! and Joon, no additional carrier-imposed surcharges apply. The exact cost will be shown in the trip overview after you have selected your flight.

handBaggageText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the hand baggages.
handBaggageText.example: * Applies to flights operated by KLM and Air France.

flexibilityText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the flexibility conditions related to the flight.
flexibilityText.example: ** Refundable in form of a voucher if you cancel before the 1st flight in your trip. Voucher is valid for 1 year from the date of issue, non-refundable and non-transferable.

optionalUMText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the flexibility conditions related to the optional Unaccompanied Minors.
optionalUMText.example: The Kids Solo service will be automatically added to your booking at the Options step. Its price is not included in the fares below.

infantAttributesSpecificitiesText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the specificities related to the infants.
infantAttributesSpecificitiesText.example: Baggage allowance and other fare conditions may vary for infant passengers. Please check applicable conditions.

Disclaimer.description: The texts to be shown as legal disclaimers regarding fare, tax, fee, baggages etc.

departureDate.description: Departure date of the trip.

duration.description: The duration in minutes of the trip.

LowestFare.description: Represents the details of a lowest fare.

flightProducts.description: The lowest fares for the destination.

LowestFaresByDestination.description: Represents the lowest fares for a given destination city.

LowestFaresByDestinationResponse.description: Represents a lowest fares by destination response.

displayPrice.description: The total price for the product. Computed for all the passengers and based on the consumer need (could be rounded up for instance).

totalPrice.description: The total price for the product. Computed for all the passengers.

surcharges.description: List of additional charges applied to an offer.

currency.description: The currency used for the fee. Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217.

displayType.description: The type of price displayed. Indicates what is included in the price displayed (only the fare, or also the fees and taxes).

code.description: Code of the surcharge (can be used to indicate if it's a booking fee).

contractNumber.description: The contract number, if the user is logged with his contract (deprecated).

reservationId.description: The reservation id, in case of rebooking.

corporateEnvId.description: The id identifying the contract in the corporate environment of the user.

companyName.description: The name of the company for which this contract has been subscribed for.

uccrId.description: The User Corporate Contract Roles Id.

restrictions.description: The restrictions applying to the contract.

possibleTravelersFromContract.description: The set of possible travelers associated to this contract (present if enriched by CCAPI).

CorporateContract.description: Represents the details of a corporate contract.

maxNumberOfPaxPerBooking.description: The maximum number of passengers that can be booked at the same time (i.e. per booking).

CorporateContractRestriction.description: Represents the restrictions applying to a contract.

travelerSource.description: The source of the traveler (eg: from the profile or a corporate contract).

firstName.description: The first name of the traveler.

lastName.description: The last name of the traveler.

PossibleTraveler.description: Represents a possible traveler associated to a customer's profile.

profileId.description: The id of the profile. It identifies the temporary context created for the logged user search.

corporateContracts.description: The corporate contracts of the logged user.

subscriberContracts.description: The subscriber contracts of the logged user.

possibleTravelersFromProfile.description: The possible travelers associated with the profile of the logged user.

profileIdExpiryDateTime.description: The expiry date of the profile id.

incompleteData.description: A flag indicating if the data returned is incomplete (can happen in case of temporary unavailable provider).

cardKey.description: The key of the subscriber card.

productType.description: The type of the product linked to the subscriber card.

productSubType.description: The sub-type of the product linked to the subscriber card.

cardLabel.description: The sub-type of the product linked to the subscriber card.

contractNumber.description: The number of the contract associated with the subscriber card.

validityStartDate.description: The validity start date of the contract associated with the subscriber card.

validityEndDate.description: The validity end date of the contract associated with the subscriber card.

profileId.description: The profile id of the customer. Used to retrieve his profile from the persistance layer.

cardKey.description: The id of the subscriber card the customer wants to use.

corporateContractKey.description: The id of the corporate contract the customer wants to use.

selectedTravelCompanions.description: The companions of the customer (from his profile, or contract) that will travel as passengers on the flight.

Customer.description: The specification of the customer information.

departureDate.description: Date of departure of the connection flight.

arrivalDate.description: Date of arrival of the connection flight.

duration.description: The duration of the connection in minutes (including flights and transfers).

fareBasis.description: Fare basis applicable to the connection as selected.

centralDateInterval.description: The central date used to compute a date interval around this date. The offers will be searched in this interval. Conditional: must be filled with the dayInterval parameter.

dayInterval.description: Used to compute a date interval in which the offers will be searched. Conditional: must be filled with the centralDateInterval parameter.

segments.description: The list of segments constituting the connection requested. Conditional: Either origin & destination of the connection are supplied or segments are supplied.

fareFamilyCode.description: The fare family of the connection. Conditional: Must not be supplied when origin & destination are supplied. Can be supplied when segments are supplied.

fareFamilyHierarchy.description: The fare family hierarchy of the connection.

estimatedFlightTime.description: The estimated flight time in minutes.

toChange.description: A flag to specify if the connection must be kept or changed. Only in rebooking or upgrade.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

bookingFlow.description: Represents a type of booking flow, i.e. the specific context in which the customer is booking a flight (eg: for leisure, as a corporate, as a staff etc.).

passengers.description: The list of passengers for which the offers are requested.

commercialCabins.description: The commercial cabins accepted for the offers requested. The commercial cabin has an impact on the quality of accomodation & services and the price of the offers returned.

items.description: Represents the possible commercial cabins, including the "ALL" option. Commercial cabins represent the different qualities of accomodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

withUpsellCabins.description: The boolean indicates whether or not the upsell cabins should be included.

departureDate.description: Date of departure of the connection flight.

additionalProperties.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

passengerCount.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

currency.description: The currency used for prices in response.  Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217.

reservationId.description: Id of the reservation. Only in case of rebooking, or upgrade.

fareOption.description: The different options to target a specific fare.

negotiatedFareOnly.description: A flag to request only negotiated fares (and not public ones), in corporate businessFlow.

officeId.description:
An id identifying the initiator of the request. An office ID can for example identify an office (eg: airlines, travel agencies, hotel proividers etc.), an agent, a terminal.
It is built based on a hierarchical structure constituted of a location code, a corporate Id (identifying a group office) and an office code.
Depending on the ID provided, specific processes might occur and dedicated data structures might be used.

arrivalDateTime.description: The arrival date and time of the segment. It is specified as local time at destination of the segment.

departureDateTime.description: The departure date and time of the segment. It is specified as local time at origin of the segment.

operatingCarrier.description: The operating carrier (i.e. the carrier actually carrying the passengers, operated by the operating airline). It can be different than the Marketing carrier (carrier selling the flight).

marketingCarrier.description: The marketing carrier (i.e. the carrier selling the flight), it can be different than the operating carrier (i.e. the carrier actually carrying the passengers).

suffix.description: A suffix to be appended at the end of the flight number, for example when a flight is canceled and rescheduled.

sellingClass.description: The selling class (also called booking class) applicable to the segment.

equipmentType.description: The equipment type used to carry the passengers.

dateVariation.description: The number of days between the dates of departure and arrival of the segment.

SegmentRequest.description: Represents a requested segment of a connection.

passengerId.description: The ID of the associated passenger in the request.

travelerKey.description: The key used to retrieve the traveler details from the persistance layer.

travelerSource.description: Represents the source from which a travel companion can come from.

TravelCompanion.description: Represents a travel companion who is a potential traveler, registered as part of the logged in customer's inner circle (can be a member of a corporate contract, a friend, a family member, etc.)

passengers.description: The list of passengers for which the flights are requested.

cardNeededForAllPax.description: A flag indicating if a discount card is needed for al passengers (eg: in case of weekend fares retrieved).

fareOption.description: The different options to target a specific fare.

fareOptionText.description: The label related to the fare option.

selfConnectText.description: The label related to the self-connect link.

youthCardSubscriptionText.description: The label related to the use of a youth card when retrieving the fares.

seniorCardSubscriptionText.description: The label related to the use of a senior card when retrieving the fares.

warnings.description: A list of warning descriptors in case of anomaly.

ConnectionIdentifier.description: The connection identifiers of the flight product resulting from the search.

connectionIdentifiers.description: The connection identifiers of the flight product resulting from the search.

name.description: The first name of the user.

surname.description: The last name of the user.

UserInformation.description: The user information needed to send an email to the user.

AirlineFilter_FlightsAvailability.description: Represents a filter on the airlines.

departureDate.description: Date of departure of the connection flight.

arrivalDate.description: Date of arrival of the connection flight.

maximumNumberOfSegments.description: The maximum number of segments expected.

withCancelledSegments.description: A flag indicating if cancelled segments must be accepted.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

items.description: The accepted pricing products.

FlightsAvailabilityFilter_FlightsAvailab.description: Represents a filter for the available flights request.

bookingFlow.description: Represents a type of booking flow, i.e. the specific context in which the customer is booking a flight (eg: for leisure, as a corporate, as a staff etc.).

passengers.description: The list of passengers for which the flights are requested.

code.description: The code of the marketing carrier.

MarketingCarrierFilter_FlightsAvailabili.description: Represents a filter on the marketing carriers.

code.description: The code of the operating airline.

withOptions.description: The set of operating airline options to apply.

items.description: Represents the different filtering options on the operating airlines.

OperatingAirlineFilter_FlightsAvailabili.description: Represents a filter on the operating airlines.

id.description: The id identifying the passenger uniquely in the request.

pnrId.description: The id of the PNR (Passenger Name Record), identifying the reservation of the passenger. Only to be set in rebooking.

minAge.description: A lower bound for the age of the passenger (used to estimate the type of the passenger).

maxAge.description: An higher bound for the age of the passenger (used to estimate the type of the passenger).

ticketNumber.description: The ticket number of the passenger in the PNR. Only to be set in rebooking.

Passenger_FlightsAvailability.description: The requested passenger of a flight.

City_FlightsAvailability.description: The location code of the station.

DateInterval_FlightsAvailability.description: Date interval describing the range of dates used when retrieving the fares related to this connection. It depends on the dateInterval asked in request.

duration.description: The duration in minutes of the trip.

segments.description: The list of segments constituting the connection.

FlightAvailabilityConnectionResponse_Fli.description: Represents a connection of an available flight.

number.description: A four digit number representing the number of the flight.

suffix.description: A suffix to be appended at the end of the flight number, for example when a flight is canceled and rescheduled.

OperatingFlight_FlightsAvailability.description: The operating flight, i.e. the flight actually carrying the passengers and operated by the operating airline/carrier.

arrivalDateTime.description: The arrival date and time of the segment.

departureDateTime.description: The departure date and time of the segment.

transferTime.description: The transfer time between the arrival of this segment and the departure of the next segment, can be null if there is no next segment.

transferLabel.description: The label linked to the transfer. This message is translated.
transferLabel.example: Your trip includes a transfer in Paris. Please note that you must collect any checked baggage from Paris Orly Airport before proceeding to Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport.

highestPriority.description: A flag indicating if this segment is the one of higher priority, in regard to its haul type.

flightDuration.description: The duration of the flight in minutes on this segment.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from an airline point of view.

operatingCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from the point of view of the operating carrier (example for a bus: the commercial cabin may be described as economy, whereas the operating cabin may be "Main cabin").

SegmentResponse_FlightsAvailability.description: Represents the segment of a connection. It focuses only on the geographical and temporal data of the trip and does not contain fare or price related information.

StationCity_FlightsAvailability.description: Represents a station (city, stopover etc.) that can be used in an itinerary.

Stopover_FlightsAvailability.description: The location code of the station.

device.description: The type of device used to retrieve the offers.

timeToThinkOptionType.description: The type of time to think option.

departureDate.description: Date of departure of the connection flight.

arrivalDate.description: Date of arrival of the connection flight.

maximumNumberOfSegments.description: The maximum number of segments expected.

items.description: The marketing carriers accepted.

bookingFlow.description: Represents a type of booking flow, i.e. the specific context in which the customer is booking a flight (eg: for leisure, as a corporate, as a staff etc.).

passengers.description: The list of passengers for which the offers are requested.

commercialCabins.description: The commercial cabins accepted for the offers requested. The commercial cabin has an impact on the quality of accomodation & services and the price of the offers returned.

items.description: Represents the possible commercial cabins, including the "ALL" option. Commercial cabins represent the different qualities of accomodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

withUpsellCabins.description: The boolean indicates whether or not the upsell cabins should be included.

departureDate.description: Date of departure of the connection flight.

additionalProperties.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

passengerCount.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

currency.description: The currency used for prices in response.  Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217.

reservationId.description: Id of the reservation. Only in case of rebooking, or upgrade.

fareOption.description: The different options to target a specific fare.

negotiatedFareOnly.description: A flag to request only negotiated fares (and not public ones), in corporate businessFlow.

officeId.description:
An id identifying the initiator of the request. An office ID can for example identify an office (eg: airlines, travel agencies, hotel proividers etc.), an agent, a terminal.
It is built based on a hierarchical structure constituted of a location code, a corporate Id (identifying a group office) and an office code.
Depending on the ID provided, specific processes might occur and dedicated data structures might be used.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

selectedTravelCompanions.description: The companions of the customer (from his profile, or contract) that will travel as passengers on the flight.

dynamicWaiver.description: Flag to indicate if a dynamic penalty waiver applies. The Dynamic Waiver is a commercial gesture which is used in case of "abnormal" operations (strike, meteorological conditions) in voluntary rebooking, and/or when the flight booked by the customer has been canceled (involuntary rebooking) etc.This waiver exempts the customer from paying the penalty fee or/and fare difference that normally apply in voluntary rebooking. Only applies when rebooking a ticket.

departureDate.description: Date of departure of the connection flight.

arrivalDate.description: Date of arrival of the connection flight.

duration.description: The duration of the connection in minutes (including flights and transfers).

fareBasis.description: Fare basis applicable to the connection as selected.

centralDateInterval.description: The central date used to compute a date interval around this date. The offers will be searched in this interval. Conditional: must be filled with the dayInterval parameter.

dayInterval.description: Used to compute a date interval in which the offers will be searched. Conditional: must be filled with the centralDateInterval parameter.

segments.description: The list of segments constituting the connection requested. Conditional: Either origin & destination of the connection are supplied or segments are supplied.

fareFamilyCode.description: The fare family of the connection. Conditional: Must not be supplied when origin & destination are supplied. Can be supplied when segments are supplied.

fareFamilyHierarchy.description: The fare family hierarchy of the connection.

estimatedFlightTime.description: The estimated flight time in minutes.

toChange.description: A flag to specify if the connection must be kept or changed. Only in rebooking or upgrade.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

id.description: The id identifying the passenger uniquely in the request.

pnrId.description: The id of the PNR (Passenger Name Record), identifying the reservation of the passenger. Only to be set in rebooking.

minAge.description: A lower bound for the age of the passenger (used to estimate the type of the passenger).

maxAge.description: An higher bound for the age of the passenger (used to estimate the type of the passenger).

ticketNumber.description: The ticket number of the passenger in the PNR. Only to be set in rebooking.

Passenger_UpsellOfferV3.description: The requested passenger of a flight.

arrivalDateTime.description: The arrival date and time of the segment. It is specified as local time at destination of the segment.

departureDateTime.description: The departure date and time of the segment. It is specified as local time at origin of the segment.

operatingCarrier.description: The operating carrier (i.e. the carrier actually carrying the passengers, operated by the operating airline). It can be different than the Marketing carrier (carrier selling the flight).

marketingCarrier.description: The marketing carrier (i.e. the carrier selling the flight), it can be different than the operating carrier (i.e. the carrier actually carrying the passengers).

suffix.description: A suffix to be appended at the end of the flight number, for example when a flight is canceled and rescheduled.

sellingClass.description: The selling class (also called booking class) applicable to the segment.

equipmentType.description: The equipment type used to carry the passengers.

dateVariation.description: The number of days between the dates of departure and arrival of the segment.

SegmentRequest_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents a requested segment of a connection.

Stopover_UpsellOfferV3.description: The destination location of the segment.

passengerId.description: The ID of the associated passenger in the request.

travelerKey.description: The key used to retrieve the traveler details from the persistance layer.

travelerSource.description: Represents the source from which a travel companion can come from.

TravelCompanion_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents a travel companion who is a potential traveler, registered as part of the logged in customer's inner circle (can be a member of a corporate contract, a friend, a family member, etc.)

bookingFlow.description: Represents a type of booking flow, i.e. the specific context in which the customer is booking a flight (eg: for leisure, as a corporate, as a staff etc.).

passengers.description: The list of passengers for which the offers are requested.

commercialCabins.description: The commercial cabins accepted for the offers requested. The commercial cabin has an impact on the quality of accomodation & services and the price of the offers returned.

items.description: Represents the possible commercial cabins, including the "ALL" option. Commercial cabins represent the different qualities of accomodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

withUpsellCabins.description: The boolean indicates whether or not the upsell cabins should be included.

departureDate.description: Date of departure of the connection flight.

additionalProperties.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

passengerCount.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

currency.description: The currency used for prices in response.  Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217.

reservationId.description: Id of the reservation. Only in case of rebooking, or upgrade.

fareOption.description: The different options to target a specific fare.

negotiatedFareOnly.description: A flag to request only negotiated fares (and not public ones), in corporate businessFlow.

officeId.description:
An id identifying the initiator of the request. An office ID can for example identify an office (eg: airlines, travel agencies, hotel proividers etc.), an agent, a terminal.
It is built based on a hierarchical structure constituted of a location code, a corporate Id (identifying a group office) and an office code.
Depending on the ID provided, specific processes might occur and dedicated data structures might be used.

focusedConnection.description: The index to the connection to retrieve (starting from 0), 0 for the outbound, 1 for the inbound

displayPriceContent.description: The different formats and content for the displayPrice value.

shortest.description: Indicates whether shortest route should be found and favoured. Otherwise lowest fare is found. This option is valid ONLY when the "booking flow" is not set or set to"Leisure".

lowestFareCombination.description: The boolean indicates whether or not the flight for each bound should be selected with the lowest price

fixedFlights.description: A flag to indicate that the flights returned in the response connections must be the same as those in the request.

ignoreCommercialCabinFilter.description: A flag to indicate that the commercial cabin should be ignored when filtering the upsell offers to return.

fallbackMode.description: The fallback mode of the filtering process.

description.example: origin city must be different from destination city AND neither or both O&D can be null at the same time

errorInInputPath.description: The path to the input element that raised the error/warning.

errorInOutputPath.description: The path to the output element that raised the error/warning.

requestContextId.description: The id of the request to be able to find more elements in the logs about the incident.

items.description: The type of errors.

AbnormalResponseDescriptor_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents the descriptor of a warning or error incident.

City_UpsellOfferV3.description: The location code of the station.

code.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

label.description: The label describing the commercial cabin. The label is translated.

CommercialCabin_UpsellOfferV3.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accomodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

relevance.description: The relevance of the commercial text. Can be null.

text.description: The details text.

CommercialText_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents a commercial text related to a ticket condition.

code.description: The code identifying the type of the condition.

included.description: A flag indicating if the fare benefit is included or not.

attributeSource.description: The source of the attribute. I.e. the reason wy the attribute is returned (eg: due to the type of fare, or the flying blue status of the customer).

relevance.description: The relevance of the attribute. Can be used for sorting purpose.

shortList.description: A flag indicating if the attribute is part of the short list of the most important attributes.

pictogram.description: Displays the pictogram of the attribute.

primaryPax.description: A flag indicating whether the passenger type is the one of the primary passenger.

ConditionsPerPassengerType_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents the ticket conditions per passenger type.

duration.description: The duration in minutes of the trip.

segments.description: The list of segments constituting the connection.

ConnectionResponse_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents the connection of an itinerary. It focuses only on the geographical and temporal data of the trip and does not contain fare or price related information.

marketRedirectText.description: Contextual message about a dynamic change in market.
marketRedirectText.example: Because of the country or region of departure you have chosen Germany, all prices will be shown in EUR.

DateIntervalView_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents a date interval to be used for the output.

displayPriceText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the price to display.
displayPriceText.example: All amounts are in EUR. Taxes and surcharges are included. No booking fee is applicable, but a payment surcharge may apply. Prices shown may vary depending on fare availability.

totalPriceText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the total price.
totalPriceText.example: All amounts are in EUR. Taxes and surcharges are included. No booking fee is applicable, but a payment surcharge may apply. Prices shown may vary depending on fare availability.

fareMilesText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the fare in miles.
fareMilesText.example: * Please note: airport taxes and security charges are not covered by your Miles and must be paid separately. The same applies for carrier-imposed surcharges. For flights within Europe operated by Air France, KLM, HOP! and Joon, no additional carrier-imposed surcharges apply. The exact cost will be shown in the trip overview after you have selected your flight.

handBaggageText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the hand baggages.
handBaggageText.example: * Applies to flights operated by KLM and Air France.

flexibilityText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the flexibility conditions related to the flight.
flexibilityText.example: ** Refundable in form of a voucher if you cancel before the 1st flight in your trip. Voucher is valid for 1 year from the date of issue, non-refundable and non-transferable.

optionalUMText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the flexibility conditions related to the optional Unaccompanied Minors.
optionalUMText.example: The Kids Solo service will be automatically added to your booking at the Options step. Its price is not included in the fares below.

infantAttributesSpecificitiesText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the specificities related to the infants.
infantAttributesSpecificitiesText.example: Baggage allowance and other fare conditions may vary for infant passengers. Please check applicable conditions.

Disclaimer_UpsellOfferV3.description: The texts to be shown as legal disclaimers regarding fare, tax, fee, baggages etc.

text.description: The text displayed for environmental information

equipInformationText.description: An optional informative text about the equipment. Usually returned in case of specific equipments like trains, bus or limousines..
equipInformationText.example: Please note: you will travel by bus for this part of the journey.

acvCode.description: The ACV code of the equipment.

EquipmentType_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents a type of equipment and the data related to it.

code.description: The code of the fare family.

bundleCode.description: The bundle code of the fare family.

hierarchy.description: The hierarchy of the fare family, indicating its order among other fareFamilies. Higher fareFamilies (eg: business flex) have lower hierarchy number.

title.description: The title of the fare family.

commercialLabel.description: The commercial label of the fare family.

FareFamily_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents a family of fares grouped according to specific airline criteria, based on the services and conditions/benefits of the airfare.

currency.description: The currency of the fee.

halfHourDelayPercentage.description: The percentage of flights having a delay of less than half an hour.

hourDelayPercentage.description: The percentage of flights having a delay of less than an hour.

FlightOnTime_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents statistics about the on-time departure of flights. This information is specifically required in point of sale Brazil.

passengers.description: List of passengers associated to the product (matching requested passenger list).

relevance.description: The relevance of the flight product based on its fareFamily and price.

recommended.description: Indicates if the current flightProduct is recommended to the customer.

FlightProduct_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents a flight product offer. It contains all the data related to the fare.

FlyingBlue_UpsellOfferV3.description: The flyingBlue conditions applicable to a FlyingBlue passenger on a flight offer.

co2CompensationText.description: Contextual information related to the CO2 compensation of the flight.
co2CompensationText.example: Fly green: Air France flights in metropolitan France are now 100% carbon neutral.

travelCorridorText.description: Contextual information related to the travel corridor program.
travelCorridorText.example: We offer quarantine-free travel to Singapore on selected Air France flights for fully vaccinated passengers, as part of Singapores Vaccinated Travel Lane (VTL) initiative. To board these designated VTL flights, please ensure you meet all the VTL requirements. These flights are labeled as a VTL flight

flightProducts.description: The list of possible flight offers for this itinerary.

number.description: A four digit number representing the number of the flight.

suffix.description: A suffix to be appended at the end of the flight number, for example when a flight is canceled and rescheduled.

OperatingFlight_UpsellOfferV3.description: The operating flight, i.e. the flight actually carrying the passengers and operated by the operating airline/carrier.

fare.description: The fare price as applicable for the passenger type.

taxes.description: The taxes price as applicable for the passenger type.

products.description: The products price as applicable for the passenger type.

surcharges.description: Surcharges applicable per passenger. Conditional: surcharge applies to either a passenger or a PNR..

price.description: The price as applicable for the passenger type.

penalty.description: The penalty price as applicable for the passenger type. Only applies to rebooking a ticket.

primaryPax.description: The flag to indicate if the passenger type this price applies to is the primary pax type.

fare.description: The fare price as applicable for the passenger.

taxes.description: The taxes price as applicable for the passenger.

products.description: The products price as applicable for the passenger type.

surcharges.description: Surcharges applicable per passenger. Conditional: surcharge applies to either a passenger or a PNR..

price.description: The price as applicable for the passenger.

penalty.description: The penalty price as applicable for the passenger. Only applies to rebooking a ticket.

displayPrice.description: The display price for the product. Computed for all the passengers and based on the consumer need (could be rounded up for instance).

adjustedDisplayPrice.description: The adjusted display price for the product. Computed for all the passengers and based on the consumer need (could be rounded up for instance).

totalPrice.description: The total price for the product. Computed for all the passengers.

adjustedTotalPrice.description: The adjusted total price for the product. Computed for all the passengers.

surcharges.description: List of additional charges applied to an offer.

pricePerPassengerTypes.description: The individual prices grouped by passenger types.

dynamicWaiver.description: Flag to indicate if a dynamic penalty waiver applies. The Dynamic Waiver is a commercial gesture which is used in case of "abnormal" operations (strike, meteorological conditions) in voluntary rebooking, and/or when the flight booked by the customer has been canceled (involuntary rebooking) etc.This waiver exempts the customer from paying the penalty fee or/and fare difference that normally apply in voluntary rebooking. Only applies when rebooking a ticket.

flexibilityWaiver.description: Flag to indicate if a flexible penalty waiver applies. Only applies to rebooking a ticket.

affordability.description: The affordability of a fare priced in miles, in reward booking flow.

currency.description: The currency used for the fee. Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217.

displayType.description: The type of price displayed. Indicates what is included in the price displayed (only the fare, or also the fees and taxes).

sameForAllSegments.description: A flag indicating if the product bought applies to all segments of the connection.

productWarningForAllSegmentsText.description: A warning text to display in case the product is not included on all segments.
productWarningForAllSegmentsText.example: On Nice to Paris no specific seat product is included.

highestPrioritySegment.description: A flag indicating if the product is included on the highest priority segment.

ProductCondition_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents the condition related to a bought product.

numberOfSeatsAvailable.description: The number of seats available on this connection.

negotiatedFare.description: Flag indicating if the fare is a negotiated one, in case of corporate booking flow.

segments.description: The list of segments making part of the connection.

travelDateIntervals.description: Travel date interval describes the range of dates for the Connection that the fare applies to.

products.description: The list of products (eg: SAF) the passenger will have access to on this connection.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin.

continuousPricing.description: The flag to indicate if continuous pricing is applied to the fare.

ProductConnection_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents the connection of a flight product.

cabinClassCode.description: The code (eg: M, W, C etc.) of the cabin class (eg: economy, business, first etc.) in which the passenger will travel on this segment. It represents the quality of accomodation & services the passenger will have access to in the airplane.

sellingClassCode.description: The selling class code (also called booking class) of the segment. It is a further (invisible) division of the cabin class that details the different conditions and benefits offered among a same cabin class. The selling class code usually is the first letter of the fare basis code.

fareBasisCode.description: The fare basis applicable to the segment. It represents a fare basis which is a alphabetic or alpha-numeric code used to identify a fare type and the rules applicable to that fare.

products.description: The list of products (eg: Extra legroom seat) the passenger will have access to on this segment.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from an airline point of view.

operatingCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from the point of view of the operating carrier (example for a bus: the commercial cabin may be described as economy, whereas the operating cabin may be "Main cabin").

ProductSegment_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents the segment in a connection of a flight product.

commercialDescription.description: The commercial label describing the product.

Product_UpsellOfferV3.description: A product (eg: Extra legroom seat, Front section seat etc.), that can be bought along the ticket.

title.description: Title of the promotion in the language as specified in Content-Language header.

level.description: The value of the rating value of the (eg: 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5 for a 5-stars rating).

count.description: The number of customers who gave this rating.

RatingCategory_UpsellOfferV3.description: The rating category. There is one category per possible rating value (5 categories, from 1 to 5 for a 5-stars rating).

ratingCategories.description: The amount of ratings per level. Starts with the 5 stars.

averageRating.description: The average rating given by the former passengers.

RatingStatistics_UpsellOfferV3.description: The rating given by former customers to a flight.

availableCommercialCabinsPerConnections.description: A list of available commercial cabins.

items.description: A list of available commercial cabins.

arrivalDateTime.description: The arrival date and time of the segment.

departureDateTime.description: The departure date and time of the segment.

stopsAt.description: The list of technical stops occurring on the segment. These stops are usually for refuelling purpose and passengers usually do not disembark the plane (as opposed to transfers).

stopInformationText.description: The label linked to the technical stop. This message is translated.
stopInformationText.example: Your Muscat - Amsterdam trip includes a stop in Dammam / Dhahran, Saudi Arabia. Please check the entry requirements for this country.

transferTime.description: The transfer time between the arrival of this segment and the departure of the next segment, can be null if there is no next segment.

transferLabel.description: The label linked to the transfer. This message is translated.
transferLabel.example: Your trip includes a transfer in Paris. Please note that you must collect any checked baggage from Paris Orly Airport before proceeding to Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport.

highestPriority.description: A flag indicating if this segment is the one of higher priority, in regard to its haul type.

dateVariation.description: The number of days between the dates of departure and arrival of the segment.

overnightLabel.description: The label accompanying the overnight flag. The label is translated.
overnightLabel.example: Your Copenhagen - Lisbon trip includes a stop in Amsterdam which may require an overnight stay at your own expense. Please check the entry requirements for this country.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from an airline point of view.

operatingCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from the point of view of the operating carrier (example for a bus: the commercial cabin may be described as economy, whereas the operating cabin may be "Main cabin").

SegmentResponse_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents the segment of a connection. It focuses only on the geographical and temporal data of the trip and does not contain fare or price related information.

StationCity_UpsellOfferV3.description: Represents a station (city, stopover etc.) that can be used in an itinerary.

code.description: Code of the surcharge (can be used to indicate if it's a booking fee).

items.description: The list of connections.

profileId.description: The profile id of the customer. Used to retrieve his profile from the persistance layer.

cardKey.description: The id of the subscriber card the customer wants to use.

corporateContractKey.description: The id of the corporate contract the customer wants to use.

selectedTravelCompanions.description: The companions of the customer (from his profile, or contract) that will travel as passengers on the flight.

surcharges.description: Surcharges applicable per passenger. Conditional: surcharge applies to either a passenger or a PNR..

price.description: The price as applicable for the passenger type.

penalty.description: The penalty price as applicable for the passenger type. Only applies to rebooking a ticket.

primaryPax.description: The flag to indicate if the passenger type this price applies to is the primary pax type.

fare.description: The fare price as applicable for the passenger.

taxes.description: The taxes price as applicable for the passenger.

products.description: The products price as applicable for the passenger type.

surcharges.description: Surcharges applicable per passenger. Conditional: surcharge applies to either a passenger or a PNR..

price.description: The price as applicable for the passenger.

penalty.description: The penalty price as applicable for the passenger. Only applies to rebooking a ticket.

displayPrice.description: The display price for the product. Computed for all the passengers and based on the consumer need (could be rounded up for instance).

adjustedDisplayPrice.description: The adjusted display price for the product. Computed for all the passengers and based on the consumer need (could be rounded up for instance).

totalPrice.description: The total price for the product. Computed for all the passengers.

adjustedTotalPrice.description: The adjusted total price for the product. Computed for all the passengers.

surcharges.description: List of additional charges applied to an offer.

pricePerPassengerTypes.description: The individual prices grouped by passenger types.

dynamicWaiver.description: Flag to indicate if a dynamic penalty waiver applies. The Dynamic Waiver is a commercial gesture which is used in case of "abnormal" operations (strike, meteorological conditions) in voluntary rebooking, and/or when the flight booked by the customer has been canceled (involuntary rebooking) etc.This waiver exempts the customer from paying the penalty fee or/and fare difference that normally apply in voluntary rebooking. Only applies when rebooking a ticket.

affordability.description: The affordability of a fare priced in miles, in reward booking flow.

currency.description: The currency used for the fee. Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217.

displayType.description: The type of price displayed. Indicates what is included in the price displayed (only the fare, or also the fees and taxes).

ProductCondition_UpgradeOffersWithMilesV.description: Represents the condition related to a bought product.

availableCommercialCabinsPerConnections.description: A list of available commercial cabins.

items.description: A list of available commercial cabins.

StationCity_UpgradeOffersWithMilesV3.description: Represents a station (city, stopover etc.) that can be used in an itinerary.

code.description: Code of the surcharge (can be used to indicate if it's a booking fee).

passengers.description: The list of passengers of the flight.

connections.description: The list of connections of the flight. All connections are returned, even none upgraded ones.

flightProducts.description: The list of possible upgraded flight offers for this itinerary.

offerConnectionId.description: The id of the offer connection. A same product connection may be returned in different flight offers and this id permits to see they are the same.

relevance.description: The relevance of the product connection upgrade based on the commercial cabin.

numberOfSeatsAvailable.description: The number of seats available on this connection for the given booking class.

segments.description: The list of segments making part of the connection.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin.

UpgradeProductConnection_UpgradeOffersWi.description: Represents the connection of an upgrade flight offer.

cabinClassCode.description: The code (eg: M, W, C etc.) of the cabin class (eg: economy, business, first etc.) in which the passenger will travel on this segment. It represents the quality of accomodation & services the passenger will have access to in the airplane.

sellingClassCode.description: The selling class code (also called booking class) of the segment. It is a further (invisible) division of the cabin class that details the different conditions and benefits offered among a same cabin class. The selling class code usually is the first letter of the fare basis code.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment.

UpgradeProductSegment_UpgradeOffersWithM.description: Represents the segment in a connection of an upgraded flight offer.

profileId.description: The profile id of the customer. Used to retrieve his profile from the persistance layer.

cardKey.description: The id of the subscriber card the customer wants to use.

corporateContractKey.description: The id of the corporate contract the customer wants to use.

selectedTravelCompanions.description: The companions of the customer (from his profile, or contract) that will travel as passengers on the flight.

Customer_UpgradeOffersWithCashV3.description: The specification of the customer information.

DateInterval_UpgradeOffersWithCashV3.description: Date interval describing the range of dates used when retrieving the fares related to this connection.

departureDate.description: Date of departure of the connection flight.

arrivalDate.description: Date of arrival of the connection flight.

duration.description: The duration of the connection in minutes (including flights and transfers).

fareBasis.description: Fare basis applicable to the connection as selected.

centralDateInterval.description: The central date used to compute a date interval around this date. The offers will be searched in this interval. Conditional: must be filled with the dayInterval parameter.

dayInterval.description: Used to compute a date interval in which the offers will be searched. Conditional: must be filled with the centralDateInterval parameter.

segments.description: The list of segments constituting the connection requested. Conditional: Either origin & destination of the connection are supplied or segments are supplied.

fareFamilyCode.description: The fare family of the connection. Conditional: Must not be supplied when origin & destination are supplied. Can be supplied when segments are supplied.

fareFamilyHierarchy.description: The fare family hierarchy of the connection.

estimatedFlightTime.description: The estimated flight time in minutes.

toChange.description: A flag to specify if the connection must be kept or changed. Only in rebooking or upgrade.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

id.description: The id identifying the passenger uniquely in the request.

pnrId.description: The id of the PNR (Passenger Name Record), identifying the reservation of the passenger. Only to be set in rebooking.

minAge.description: A lower bound for the age of the passenger (used to estimate the type of the passenger).

maxAge.description: An higher bound for the age of the passenger (used to estimate the type of the passenger).

ticketNumber.description: The ticket number of the passenger in the PNR. Only to be set in rebooking.

Passenger_UpgradeOffersWithCashV3.description: The requested passenger of a flight.

arrivalDateTime.description: The arrival date and time of the segment. It is specified as local time at destination of the segment.

departureDateTime.description: The departure date and time of the segment. It is specified as local time at origin of the segment.

operatingCarrier.description: The operating carrier (i.e. the carrier actually carrying the passengers, operated by the operating airline). It can be different than the Marketing carrier (carrier selling the flight).

marketingCarrier.description: The marketing carrier (i.e. the carrier selling the flight), it can be different than the operating carrier (i.e. the carrier actually carrying the passengers).

suffix.description: A suffix to be appended at the end of the flight number, for example when a flight is canceled and rescheduled.

sellingClass.description: The selling class (also called booking class) applicable to the segment.

equipmentType.description: The equipment type used to carry the passengers.

dateVariation.description: The number of days between the dates of departure and arrival of the segment.

SegmentRequest_UpgradeOffersWithCashV3.description: Represents a requested segment of a connection.

Stopover_UpgradeOffersWithCashV3.description: The destination location of the segment.

passengerId.description: The ID of the associated passenger in the request.

travelerKey.description: The key used to retrieve the traveler details from the persistance layer.

travelerSource.description: Represents the source from which a travel companion can come from.

TravelCompanion_UpgradeOffersWithCashV3.description: Represents a travel companion who is a potential traveler, registered as part of the logged in customer's inner circle (can be a member of a corporate contract, a friend, a family member, etc.)

bookingFlow.description: Represents a type of booking flow, i.e. the specific context in which the customer is booking a flight (eg: for leisure, as a corporate, as a staff etc.).

passengers.description: The list of passengers for which the offers are requested.

commercialCabins.description: The commercial cabins accepted for the offers requested. The commercial cabin has an impact on the quality of accomodation & services and the price of the offers returned.

items.description: Represents the possible commercial cabins, including the "ALL" option. Commercial cabins represent the different qualities of accomodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

withUpsellCabins.description: The boolean indicates whether or not the upsell cabins should be included.

departureDate.description: Date of departure of the connection flight.

additionalProperties.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

passengerCount.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

currency.description: The currency used for prices in response.  Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217.

reservationId.description: Id of the reservation. Only in case of rebooking, or upgrade.

fareOption.description: The different options to target a specific fare.

negotiatedFareOnly.description: A flag to request only negotiated fares (and not public ones), in corporate businessFlow.

officeId.description:
An id identifying the initiator of the request. An office ID can for example identify an office (eg: airlines, travel agencies, hotel proividers etc.), an agent, a terminal.
It is built based on a hierarchical structure constituted of a location code, a corporate Id (identifying a group office) and an office code.
Depending on the ID provided, specific processes might occur and dedicated data structures might be used.

focusedConnection.description: The index to the connection to retrieve (starting from 0), 0 for the outbound, 1 for the inbound

displayPriceContent.description: The different formats and content for the displayPrice value.

shortest.description: Indicates whether shortest route should be found and favoured. Otherwise lowest fare is found. This option is valid ONLY when the "booking flow" is not set or set to"Leisure".

lowestFareCombination.description: The boolean indicates whether or not the flight for each bound should be selected with the lowest price

fallbackMode.description: The fallback mode of the filtering process.

City_UpgradeOffersWithCashV3.description: The location code of the station.

code.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

label.description: The label describing the commercial cabin. The label is translated.

included.description: A flag indicating if the fare benefit is included or not.
