marketRedirectText.description: Contextual message about a dynamic change in market.
marketRedirectText.example: Because of the country or region of departure you have chosen Germany, all prices will be shown in EUR.

displayPriceText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the price to display.
displayPriceText.example: All amounts are in EUR. Taxes and surcharges are included. No booking fee is applicable, but a payment surcharge may apply. Prices shown may vary depending on fare availability.

totalPriceText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the total price.
totalPriceText.example: All amounts are in EUR. Taxes and surcharges are included. No booking fee is applicable, but a payment surcharge may apply. Prices shown may vary depending on fare availability.

fareMilesText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the fare in miles.
fareMilesText.example: * Please note: airport taxes and security charges are not covered by your Miles and must be paid separately. The same applies for carrier-imposed surcharges. For flights within Europe operated by Air France, KLM, HOP! and Joon, no additional carrier-imposed surcharges apply. The exact cost will be shown in the trip overview after you have selected your flight.

handBaggageText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the hand baggages.
handBaggageText.example: * Applies to flights operated by KLM and Air France.

flexibilityText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the flexibility conditions related to the flight.
flexibilityText.example: ** Refundable in form of a voucher if you cancel before the 1st flight in your trip. Voucher is valid for 1 year from the date of issue, non-refundable and non-transferable.

optionalUMText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the flexibility conditions related to the optional Unaccompanied Minors.
optionalUMText.example: The Kids Solo service will be automatically added to your booking at the Options step. Its price is not included in the fares below.

infantAttributesSpecificitiesText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the specificities related to the infants.
infantAttributesSpecificitiesText.example: Baggage allowance and other fare conditions may vary for infant passengers. Please check applicable conditions.

Disclaimer_FareV3.description: The texts to be shown as legal disclaimers regarding fare, tax, fee, baggages etc.

text.description: The text displayed for environmental information

passengers.description: List of passengers associated to the product (matching requested passenger list).

calculationTimestamp.description: The date and time at which the data related to this product have been calculated by the providing service.

type.description: The different periods of time that can be considered when requesting lowest fares.

FlightProduct_FareV3.description: Represents a flight product offer. It contains all the data related to the fare.

co2CompensationText.description: Contextual information related to the CO2 compensation of the flight.
co2CompensationText.example: Fly green: Air France flights in metropolitan France are now 100% carbon neutral.

travelCorridorText.description: Contextual information related to the travel corridor program.
travelCorridorText.example: We offer quarantine-free travel to Singapore on selected Air France flights for fully vaccinated passengers, as part of Singapores Vaccinated Travel Lane (VTL) initiative. To board these designated VTL flights, please ensure you meet all the VTL requirements. These flights are labeled as a VTL flight

flightProducts.description: The list of possible flight offers for this itinerary.

items.description: The list of connections.

fare.description: The fare price as applicable for the passenger type.

taxes.description: The taxes price as applicable for the passenger type.

products.description: The products price as applicable for the passenger type.

surcharges.description: Surcharges applicable per passenger. Conditional: surcharge applies to either a passenger or a PNR..

price.description: The price as applicable for the passenger type.

penalty.description: The penalty price as applicable for the passenger type. Only applies to rebooking a ticket.

primaryPax.description: The flag to indicate if the passenger type this price applies to is the primary pax type.

fare.description: The fare price as applicable for the passenger.

taxes.description: The taxes price as applicable for the passenger.

products.description: The products price as applicable for the passenger type.

surcharges.description: Surcharges applicable per passenger. Conditional: surcharge applies to either a passenger or a PNR..

price.description: The price as applicable for the passenger.

penalty.description: The penalty price as applicable for the passenger. Only applies to rebooking a ticket.

displayPrice.description: The display price for the product. Computed for all the passengers and based on the consumer need (could be rounded up for instance).

adjustedDisplayPrice.description: The adjusted display price for the product. Computed for all the passengers and based on the consumer need (could be rounded up for instance).

totalPrice.description: The total price for the product. Computed for all the passengers.

adjustedTotalPrice.description: The adjusted total price for the product. Computed for all the passengers.

surcharges.description: List of additional charges applied to an offer.

pricePerPassengerTypes.description: The individual prices grouped by passenger types.

dynamicWaiver.description: Flag to indicate if a dynamic penalty waiver applies. The Dynamic Waiver is a commercial gesture which is used in case of "abnormal" operations (strike, meteorological conditions) in voluntary rebooking, and/or when the flight booked by the customer has been canceled (involuntary rebooking) etc.This waiver exempts the customer from paying the penalty fee or/and fare difference that normally apply in voluntary rebooking. Only applies when rebooking a ticket.

flexibilityWaiver.description: Flag to indicate if a flexible penalty waiver applies. Only applies to rebooking a ticket.

currency.description: The currency used for the fee. Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217.

displayType.description: The type of price displayed. Indicates what is included in the price displayed (only the fare, or also the fees and taxes).

numberOfSeatsAvailable.description: The number of seats available on this connection.

negotiatedFare.description: Flag indicating if the fare is a negotiated one, in case of corporate booking flow.

segments.description: The list of segments making part of the connection.

products.description: The list of products (eg: SAF) the passenger will have access to on this connection.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin.

continuousPricing.description: The flag to indicate if continuous pricing is applied to the fare.

ProductConnection_FareV3.description: Represents the connection of a flight product.

cabinClassCode.description: The code (eg: M, W, C etc.) of the cabin class (eg: economy, business, first etc.) in which the passenger will travel on this segment. It represents the quality of accomodation & services the passenger will have access to in the airplane.

sellingClassCode.description: The selling class code (also called booking class) of the segment. It is a further (invisible) division of the cabin class that details the different conditions and benefits offered among a same cabin class. The selling class code usually is the first letter of the fare basis code.

fareBasisCode.description: The fare basis applicable to the segment. It represents a fare basis which is a alphabetic or alpha-numeric code used to identify a fare type and the rules applicable to that fare.

products.description: The list of products (eg: Extra legroom seat) the passenger will have access to on this segment.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from an airline point of view.

operatingCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from the point of view of the operating carrier (example for a bus: the commercial cabin may be described as economy, whereas the operating cabin may be "Main cabin").

ProductSegment_FareV3.description: Represents the segment in a connection of a flight product.

commercialDescription.description: The commercial label describing the product.

Product_FareV3.description: A product (eg: Extra legroom seat, Front section seat etc.), that can be bought along the ticket.

title.description: Title of the promotion in the language as specified in Content-Language header.

availableCommercialCabinsPerConnections.description: A list of available commercial cabins.

items.description: A list of available commercial cabins.

StationCity_FareV3.description: Represents a station (city, stopover etc.) that can be used in an itinerary.

code.description: Code of the surcharge (can be used to indicate if it's a booking fee).

passengers.description: The list of selected passengers.

fareOption.description: The different options to target a specific fare.

bookingFlow.description: Represents a type of booking flow, i.e. the specific context in which the customer is booking a flight (eg: for leisure, as a corporate, as a staff etc.).

passengers.description: The list of passengers for which the offers are requested.

commercialCabins.description: The commercial cabins accepted for the offers requested. The commercial cabin has an impact on the quality of accomodation & services and the price of the offers returned.

items.description: Represents the possible commercial cabins, including the "ALL" option. Commercial cabins represent the different qualities of accomodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

withUpsellCabins.description: The boolean indicates whether or not the upsell cabins should be included.

departureDate.description: Date of departure of the connection flight.

additionalProperties.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

passengerCount.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

currency.description: The currency used for prices in response.  Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217.

reservationId.description: Id of the reservation. Only in case of rebooking, or upgrade.

fareOption.description: The different options to target a specific fare.

negotiatedFareOnly.description: A flag to request only negotiated fares (and not public ones), in corporate businessFlow.

officeId.description:
An id identifying the initiator of the request. An office ID can for example identify an office (eg: airlines, travel agencies, hotel proividers etc.), an agent, a terminal.
It is built based on a hierarchical structure constituted of a location code, a corporate Id (identifying a group office) and an office code.
Depending on the ID provided, specific processes might occur and dedicated data structures might be used.

focusedConnection.description: The index to the connection to retrieve (starting from 0), 0 for the outbound, 1 for the inbound

displayPriceContent.description: The different formats and content for the displayPrice value.

shortest.description: Indicates whether shortest route should be found and favoured. Otherwise lowest fare is found. This option is valid ONLY when the "booking flow" is not set or set to"Leisure".

lowestFareCombination.description: The boolean indicates whether or not the flight for each bound should be selected with the lowest price

includeCarriers.description: The carriers that should be used in the offers requested.

items.description: The carriers that should be used in the offers requested.

fixCalendarSize.description: The size of the calendar in days.

fallbackMode.description: The fallback mode of the filtering process.

bookingFlow.description: Represents a type of booking flow, i.e. the specific context in which the customer is booking a flight (eg: for leisure, as a corporate, as a staff etc.).

passengers.description: The list of passengers for which the offers are requested.

commercialCabins.description: The commercial cabins accepted for the offers requested. The commercial cabin has an impact on the quality of accomodation & services and the price of the offers returned.

items.description: Represents the possible commercial cabins, including the "ALL" option. Commercial cabins represent the different qualities of accomodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

departureDate.description: Date of departure of the connection flight.

additionalProperties.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

passengerCount.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

currency.description: The currency used for prices in response.  Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217.

reservationId.description: Id of the reservation. Only in case of rebooking, or upgrade.

fareOption.description: The different options to target a specific fare.

negotiatedFareOnly.description: A flag to request only negotiated fares (and not public ones), in corporate businessFlow.

An id identifying the initiator of the request. An office ID can for example identify an office (eg: airlines, travel agencies, hotel proividers etc.), an agent, a terminal.
It is built based on a hierarchical structure constituted of a location code, a corporate Id (identifying a group office) and an office code.
Depending on the ID provided, specific processes might occur and dedicated data structures might be used.

focusedConnection.description: The index to the connection to retrieve (starting from 0), 0 for the outbound, 1 for the inbound

displayPriceContent.description: The different formats and content for the displayPrice value.

shortest.description: Indicates whether shortest route should be found and favoured. Otherwise lowest fare is found. This option is valid ONLY when the "booking flow" is not set or set to"Leisure".

lowestFareCombination.description: The boolean indicates whether or not the flight for each bound should be selected with the lowest price

fallbackMode.description: The fallback mode of the filtering process.

profileId.description: The profile id of the customer. Used to retrieve his profile from the persistance layer.

cardKey.description: The id of the subscriber card the customer wants to use.

corporateContractKey.description: The id of the corporate contract the customer wants to use.

selectedTravelCompanions.description: The companions of the customer (from his profile, or contract) that will travel as passengers on the flight.

Customer_OfferV3.description: The specification of the customer information.

DateInterval_OfferV3.description: Date interval describing the range of dates used when retrieving the fares related to this connection.

departureDate.description: Date of departure of the connection flight.

arrivalDate.description: Date of arrival of the connection flight.

duration.description: The duration of the connection in minutes (including flights and transfers).

fareBasis.description: Fare basis applicable to the connection as selected.

centralDateInterval.description: The central date used to compute a date interval around this date. The offers will be searched in this interval. Conditional: must be filled with the dayInterval parameter.

dayInterval.description: Used to compute a date interval in which the offers will be searched. Conditional: must be filled with the centralDateInterval parameter.

segments.description: The list of segments constituting the connection requested. Conditional: Either origin & destination of the connection are supplied or segments are supplied.

fareFamilyCode.description: The fare family of the connection. Conditional: Must not be supplied when origin & destination are supplied. Can be supplied when segments are supplied.

fareFamilyHierarchy.description: The fare family hierarchy of the connection.

estimatedFlightTime.description: The estimated flight time in minutes.

toChange.description: A flag to specify if the connection must be kept or changed. Only in rebooking or upgrade.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

id.description: The id identifying the passenger uniquely in the request.

pnrId.description: The id of the PNR (Passenger Name Record), identifying the reservation of the passenger. Only to be set in rebooking.

minAge.description: A lower bound for the age of the passenger (used to estimate the type of the passenger).

maxAge.description: An higher bound for the age of the passenger (used to estimate the type of the passenger).

ticketNumber.description: The ticket number of the passenger in the PNR. Only to be set in rebooking.

Passenger_OfferV3.description: The requested passenger of a flight.

arrivalDateTime.description: The arrival date and time of the segment. It is specified as local time at destination of the segment.

departureDateTime.description: The departure date and time of the segment. It is specified as local time at origin of the segment.

operatingCarrier.description: The operating carrier (i.e. the carrier actually carrying the passengers, operated by the operating airline). It can be different than the Marketing carrier (carrier selling the flight).

marketingCarrier.description: The marketing carrier (i.e. the carrier selling the flight), it can be different than the operating carrier (i.e. the carrier actually carrying the passengers).

suffix.description: A suffix to be appended at the end of the flight number, for example when a flight is canceled and rescheduled.

sellingClass.description: The selling class (also called booking class) applicable to the segment.

equipmentType.description: The equipment type used to carry the passengers.

dateVariation.description: The number of days between the dates of departure and arrival of the segment.

SegmentRequest_OfferV3.description: Represents a requested segment of a connection.

Stopover_OfferV3.description: The destination location of the segment.

passengerId.description: The ID of the associated passenger in the request.

travelerKey.description: The key used to retrieve the traveler details from the persistance layer.

travelerSource.description: Represents the source from which a travel companion can come from.

TravelCompanion_OfferV3.description: Represents a travel companion who is a potential traveler, registered as part of the logged in customer's inner circle (can be a member of a corporate contract, a friend, a family member, etc.)

description.example: origin city must be different from destination city AND neither or both O&D can be null at the same time

errorInInputPath.description: The path to the input element that raised the error/warning.

errorInOutputPath.description: The path to the output element that raised the error/warning.

requestContextId.description: The id of the request to be able to find more elements in the logs about the incident.

items.description: The type of errors.

AbnormalResponseDescriptor_OfferV3.description: Represents the descriptor of a warning or error incident.

items.description: The list of connections.

City_OfferV3.description: The location code of the station.

code.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

label.description: The label describing the commercial cabin. The label is translated.

It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

duration.description: The duration in minutes of the trip.

flightCharacteristics.description: The list of specific characteristics linked to the flight (example: CO2 compensation).

segments.description: The list of segments constituting the connection.

marketRedirectText.description: Contextual message about a dynamic change in market.
marketRedirectText.example: Because of the country or region of departure you have chosen Germany, all prices will be shown in EUR.

displayPriceText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the price to display.
displayPriceText.example: All amounts are in EUR. Taxes and surcharges are included. No booking fee is applicable, but a payment surcharge may apply. Prices shown may vary depending on fare availability.

totalPriceText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the total price.
totalPriceText.example: All amounts are in EUR. Taxes and surcharges are included. No booking fee is applicable, but a payment surcharge may apply. Prices shown may vary depending on fare availability.

fareMilesText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the fare in miles.
fareMilesText.example: * Please note: airport taxes and security charges are not covered by your Miles and must be paid separately. The same applies for carrier-imposed surcharges. For flights within Europe operated by Air France, KLM, HOP! and Joon, no additional carrier-imposed surcharges apply. The exact cost will be shown in the trip overview after you have selected your flight.

handBaggageText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the hand baggages.
handBaggageText.example: * Applies to flights operated by KLM and Air France.

equipInformationText.description: An optional informative text about the equipment. Usually returned in case of specific equipments like trains, bus or limousines..
equipInformationText.example: Please note: you will travel by bus for this part of the journey.

acvCode.description: The ACV code of the equipment.

EquipmentType_OfferV3.description: Represents a type of equipment and the data related to it.

code.description: The code of the fare family.

bundleCode.description: The bundle code of the fare family.

hierarchy.description: The hierarchy of the fare family, indicating its order among other fareFamilies. Higher fareFamilies (eg: business flex) have lower hierarchy number.

code.description: The codes of the possible flight characteristics.

label.description: The label describing the characteristic. Translated in the language as specified in ContentLanguage header.

halfHourDelayPercentage.description: The percentage of flights having a delay of less than half an hour.

hourDelayPercentage.description: The percentage of flights having a delay of less than an hour.

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin.

SelfConnectProductConnection_OfferV3.description: Represents the connection of a self-connect flight product.

cabinClassCode.description: The code (eg: M, W, C etc.) of the cabin class (eg: economy, business, first etc.) in which the passenger will travel on this segment. It represents the quality of accomodation & services the passenger will have access to in the airplane.

sellingClassCode.description: The selling class code (also called booking class) of the segment. It is a further (invisible) division of the cabin class that details the different conditions and benefits offered among a same cabin class. The selling class code usually is the first letter of the fare basis code.

products.description: The list of products (eg: Extra legroom seat) the passenger will have access to on this segment.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment.

SelfConnectProductSegment_OfferV3.description: Represents the segment in a connection of a self-connect flight product.

label.description: The label describing the service.
label.example: Guaranteed connection. Protects you from flight cancellations.

profileId.description: The profile id of the customer. Used to retrieve his profile from the persistance layer.

cardKey.description: The id of the subscriber card the customer wants to use.

corporateContractKey.description: The id of the corporate contract the customer wants to use.

selectedTravelCompanions.description: The companions of the customer (from his profile, or contract) that will travel as passengers on the flight.

Customer_UpsellOfferV2.description: The specification of the customer information.

DateInterval_UpsellOfferV2.description: Date interval describing the range of dates used when retrieving the fares related to this connection.

departureDate.description: Date of departure of the connection flight.

arrivalDate.description: Date of arrival of the connection flight.

duration.description: The duration of the connection in minutes (including flights and transfers).

fareBasis.description: Fare basis applicable to the connection as selected.

centralDateInterval.description: The central date used to compute a date interval around this date. The offers will be searched in this interval. Conditional: must be filled with the dayInterval parameter.

dayInterval.description: Used to compute a date interval in which the offers will be searched. Conditional: must be filled with the centralDateInterval parameter.

segments.description: The list of segments constituting the connection requested. Conditional: Either origin & destination of the connection are supplied or segments are supplied.

fareFamilyCode.description: The fare family of the connection. Conditional: Must not be supplied when origin & destination are supplied. Can be supplied when segments are supplied.

fareFamilyHierarchy.description: The fare family hierarchy of the connection.

estimatedFlightTime.description: The estimated flight time in minutes.

toChange.description: A flag to specify if the connection must be kept or changed. Only in rebooking or upgrade.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

id.description: The id identifying the passenger uniquely in the request.

pnrId.description: The id of the PNR (Passenger Name Record), identifying the reservation of the passenger. Only to be set in rebooking.

minAge.description: A lower bound for the age of the passenger (used to estimate the type of the passenger).

maxAge.description: An higher bound for the age of the passenger (used to estimate the type of the passenger).

ticketNumber.description: The ticket number of the passenger in the PNR. Only to be set in rebooking.

Passenger_UpsellOfferV2.description: The requested passenger of a flight.

arrivalDateTime.description: The arrival date and time of the segment. It is specified as local time at destination of the segment.

departureDateTime.description: The departure date and time of the segment. It is specified as local time at origin of the segment.

operatingCarrier.description: The operating carrier (i.e. the carrier actually carrying the passengers, operated by the operating airline). It can be different than the Marketing carrier (carrier selling the flight).

marketingCarrier.description: The marketing carrier (i.e. the carrier selling the flight), it can be different than the operating carrier (i.e. the carrier actually carrying the passengers).

suffix.description: A suffix to be appended at the end of the flight number, for example when a flight is canceled and rescheduled.

sellingClass.description: The selling class (also called booking class) applicable to the segment.

equipmentType.description: The equipment type used to carry the passengers.

dateVariation.description: The number of days between the dates of departure and arrival of the segment.

SegmentRequest_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents a requested segment of a connection.

Stopover_UpsellOfferV2.description: The destination location of the segment.

passengerId.description: The ID of the associated passenger in the request.

travelerKey.description: The key used to retrieve the traveler details from the persistance layer.

travelerSource.description: Represents the source from which a travel companion can come from.

TravelCompanion_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents a travel companion who is a potential traveler, registered as part of the logged in customer's inner circle (can be a member of a corporate contract, a friend, a family member, etc.)

bookingFlow.description: Represents a type of booking flow, i.e. the specific context in which the customer is booking a flight (eg: for leisure, as a corporate, as a staff etc.).

passengers.description: The list of passengers for which the offers are requested.

commercialCabins.description: The commercial cabins accepted for the offers requested. The commercial cabin has an impact on the quality of accomodation & services and the price of the offers returned.

items.description: Represents the possible commercial cabins, including the "ALL" option. Commercial cabins represent the different qualities of accomodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

withUpsellCabins.description: The boolean indicates whether or not the upsell cabins should be included.

departureDate.description: Date of departure of the connection flight.

additionalProperties.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

passengerCount.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

currency.description: The currency used for prices in response.  Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217.

reservationId.description: Id of the reservation. Only in case of rebooking, or upgrade.

fareOption.description: The different options to target a specific fare.

negotiatedFareOnly.description: A flag to request only negotiated fares (and not public ones), in corporate businessFlow.

officeId.description:
An id identifying the initiator of the request. An office ID can for example identify an office (eg: airlines, travel agencies, hotel proividers etc.), an agent, a terminal.
It is built based on a hierarchical structure constituted of a location code, a corporate Id (identifying a group office) and an office code.
Depending on the ID provided, specific processes might occur and dedicated data structures might be used.

focusedConnection.description: The index to the connection to retrieve (starting from 0), 0 for the outbound, 1 for the inbound

displayPriceContent.description: The different formats and content for the displayPrice value.

shortest.description: Indicates whether shortest route should be found and favoured. Otherwise lowest fare is found. This option is valid ONLY when the "booking flow" is not set or set to"Leisure".

lowestFareCombination.description: The boolean indicates whether or not the flight for each bound should be selected with the lowest price

fixedFlights.description: A flag to indicate that the flights returned in the response connections must be the same as those in the request.

ignoreCommercialCabinFilter.description: A flag to indicate that the commercial cabin should be ignored when filtering the upsell offers to return.

fallbackMode.description: The fallback mode of the filtering process.

description.example: origin city must be different from destination city AND neither or both O&D can be null at the same time

errorInInputPath.description: The path to the input element that raised the error/warning.

errorInOutputPath.description: The path to the output element that raised the error/warning.

requestContextId.description: The id of the request to be able to find more elements in the logs about the incident.

items.description: The type of errors.

AbnormalResponseDescriptor_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents the descriptor of a warning or error incident.

City_UpsellOfferV2.description: The location code of the station.

code.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

label.description: The label describing the commercial cabin. The label is translated.

CommercialCabin_UpsellOfferV2.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accomodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

relevance.description: The relevance of the commercial text. Can be null.

text.description: The details text.

CommercialText_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents a commercial text related to a ticket condition.

code.description: The code identifying the type of the condition.

included.description: A flag indicating if the fare benefit is included or not.

attributeSource.description: The source of the attribute. I.e. the reason wy the attribute is returned (eg: due to the type of fare, or the flying blue status of the customer).

relevance.description: The relevance of the attribute. Can be used for sorting purpose.

shortList.description: A flag indicating if the attribute is part of the short list of the most important attributes.

primaryPax.description: A flag indicating whether the passenger type is the one of the primary passenger.

ConditionsPerPassengerType_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents the ticket conditions per passenger type.

duration.description: The duration in minutes of the trip.

segments.description: The list of segments constituting the connection.

ConnectionResponse_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents the connection of an itinerary. It focuses only on the geographical and temporal data of the trip and does not contain fare or price related information.

marketRedirectText.description: Contextual message about a dynamic change in market.
marketRedirectText.example: Because of the country or region of departure you have chosen Germany, all prices will be shown in EUR.

DateIntervalView_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents a date interval to be used for the output.

displayPriceText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the price to display.
displayPriceText.example: All amounts are in EUR. Taxes and surcharges are included. No booking fee is applicable, but a payment surcharge may apply. Prices shown may vary depending on fare availability.

totalPriceText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the total price.
totalPriceText.example: All amounts are in EUR. Taxes and surcharges are included. No booking fee is applicable, but a payment surcharge may apply. Prices shown may vary depending on fare availability.

fareMilesText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the fare in miles.
fareMilesText.example: * Please note: airport taxes and security charges are not covered by your Miles and must be paid separately. The same applies for carrier-imposed surcharges. For flights within Europe operated by Air France, KLM, HOP! and Joon, no additional carrier-imposed surcharges apply. The exact cost will be shown in the trip overview after you have selected your flight.

handBaggageText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the hand baggages.
handBaggageText.example: * Applies to flights operated by KLM and Air France.

flexibilityText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the flexibility conditions related to the flight.
flexibilityText.example: ** Refundable in form of a voucher if you cancel before the 1st flight in your trip. Voucher is valid for 1 year from the date of issue, non-refundable and non-transferable.

optionalUMText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the flexibility conditions related to the optional Unaccompanied Minors.
optionalUMText.example: The Kids Solo service will be automatically added to your booking at the Options step. Its price is not included in the fares below.

infantAttributesSpecificitiesText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the specificities related to the infants.
infantAttributesSpecificitiesText.example: Baggage allowance and other fare conditions may vary for infant passengers. Please check applicable conditions.

Disclaimer_UpsellOfferV2.description: The texts to be shown as legal disclaimers regarding fare, tax, fee, baggages etc.

text.description: The text displayed for environmental information

equipInformationText.description: An optional informative text about the equipment. Usually returned in case of specific equipments like trains, bus or limousines..
equipInformationText.example: Please note: you will travel by bus for this part of the journey.

acvCode.description: The ACV code of the equipment.

EquipmentType_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents a type of equipment and the data related to it.

code.description: The code of the fare family.

bundleCode.description: The bundle code of the fare family.

hierarchy.description: The hierarchy of the fare family, indicating its order among other fareFamilies. Higher fareFamilies (eg: business flex) have lower hierarchy number.

title.description: The title of the fare family.

commercialLabel.description: The commercial label of the fare family.

FareFamily_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents a family of fares grouped according to specific airline criteria, based on the services and conditions/benefits of the airfare.

currency.description: The currency of the fee.

halfHourDelayPercentage.description: The percentage of flights having a delay of less than half an hour.

hourDelayPercentage.description: The percentage of flights having a delay of less than an hour.

FlightOnTime_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents statistics about the on-time departure of flights. This information is specifically required in point of sale Brazil.

passengers.description: List of passengers associated to the product (matching requested passenger list).

relevance.description: The relevance of the flight product based on its fareFamily and price.

FlightProduct_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents a flight product offer. It contains all the data related to the fare.

FlyingBlue_UpsellOfferV2.description: The flyingBlue conditions applicable to a FlyingBlue passenger on a flight offer.

co2CompensationText.description: Contextual information related to the CO2 compensation of the flight.
co2CompensationText.example: Fly green: Air France flights in metropolitan France are now 100% carbon neutral.

travelCorridorText.description: Contextual information related to the travel corridor program.
travelCorridorText.example: We offer quarantine-free travel to Singapore on selected Air France flights for fully vaccinated passengers, as part of Singapores Vaccinated Travel Lane (VTL) initiative. To board these designated VTL flights, please ensure you meet all the VTL requirements. These flights are labeled as a VTL flight

flightProducts.description: The list of possible flight offers for this itinerary.

locationSpecificRemarks.description: A list of remarks specific to the locations constituting the itinerary.

connections.description: The list of connections constituting the itinerary.

remarkCode.description: The code associated with the remark.

remarkText.description: The label of the remark translated in the language specified in Content-Language header.
remarkText.example: You must obtain authorization online for all travels to, from, or through the United States. This measure applies to residents of all countries in the Visa Waiver Program (VWP).

LocationSpecificRemark_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents a remark specific to the locations constituting an itinerary.

number.description: A four digit number representing the number of the flight.

suffix.description: A suffix to be appended at the end of the flight number, for example when a flight is canceled and rescheduled.

OperatingFlight_UpsellOfferV2.description: The operating flight, i.e. the flight actually carrying the passengers and operated by the operating airline/carrier.

fare.description: The fare price as applicable for the passenger type.

taxes.description: The taxes price as applicable for the passenger type.

products.description: The products price as applicable for the passenger type.

surcharges.description: Surcharges applicable per passenger. Conditional: surcharge applies to either a passenger or a PNR..

price.description: The price as applicable for the passenger type.

penalty.description: The penalty price as applicable for the passenger type. Only applies to rebooking a ticket.

primaryPax.description: The flag to indicate if the passenger type this price applies to is the primary pax type.

fare.description: The fare price as applicable for the passenger.

taxes.description: The taxes price as applicable for the passenger.

products.description: The products price as applicable for the passenger type.

surcharges.description: Surcharges applicable per passenger. Conditional: surcharge applies to either a passenger or a PNR..

price.description: The price as applicable for the passenger.

penalty.description: The penalty price as applicable for the passenger. Only applies to rebooking a ticket.

displayPrice.description: The display price for the product. Computed for all the passengers and based on the consumer need (could be rounded up for instance).

adjustedDisplayPrice.description: The adjusted display price for the product. Computed for all the passengers and based on the consumer need (could be rounded up for instance).

totalPrice.description: The total price for the product. Computed for all the passengers.

adjustedTotalPrice.description: The adjusted total price for the product. Computed for all the passengers.

surcharges.description: List of additional charges applied to an offer.

pricePerPassengerTypes.description: The individual prices grouped by passenger types.

dynamicWaiver.description: Flag to indicate if a dynamic penalty waiver applies. The Dynamic Waiver is a commercial gesture which is used in case of "abnormal" operations (strike, meteorological conditions) in voluntary rebooking, and/or when the flight booked by the customer has been canceled (involuntary rebooking) etc.This waiver exempts the customer from paying the penalty fee or/and fare difference that normally apply in voluntary rebooking. Only applies when rebooking a ticket.

flexibilityWaiver.description: Flag to indicate if a flexible penalty waiver applies. Only applies to rebooking a ticket.

affordability.description: The affordability of a fare priced in miles, in reward booking flow.

affordable.description: Flag to indicate if the user can afford the ticket.

currency.description: The currency used for the fee. Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217.

displayType.description: The type of price displayed. Indicates what is included in the price displayed (only the fare, or also the fees and taxes).

sameForAllSegments.description: A flag indicating if the product bought applies to all segments of the connection.

productWarningForAllSegmentsText.description: A warning text to display in case the product is not included on all segments.
productWarningForAllSegmentsText.example: On Nice to Paris no specific seat product is included.

highestPrioritySegment.description: A flag indicating if the product is included on the highest priority segment.

ProductCondition_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents the condition related to a bought product.

numberOfSeatsAvailable.description: The number of seats available on this connection.

negotiatedFare.description: Flag indicating if the fare is a negotiated one, in case of corporate booking flow.

segments.description: The list of segments making part of the connection.

travelDateIntervals.description: Travel date interval describes the range of dates for the Connection that the fare applies to.

products.description: The list of products (eg: SAF) the passenger will have access to on this connection.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin.

continuousPricing.description: The flag to indicate if continuous pricing is applied to the fare.

ProductConnection_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents the connection of a flight product.

cabinClassCode.description: The code (eg: M, W, C etc.) of the cabin class (eg: economy, business, first etc.) in which the passenger will travel on this segment. It represents the quality of accomodation & services the passenger will have access to in the airplane.

sellingClassCode.description: The selling class code (also called booking class) of the segment. It is a further (invisible) division of the cabin class that details the different conditions and benefits offered among a same cabin class. The selling class code usually is the first letter of the fare basis code.

fareBasisCode.description: The fare basis applicable to the segment. It represents a fare basis which is a alphabetic or alpha-numeric code used to identify a fare type and the rules applicable to that fare.

products.description: The list of products (eg: Extra legroom seat) the passenger will have access to on this segment.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from an airline point of view.

operatingCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from the point of view of the operating carrier (example for a bus: the commercial cabin may be described as economy, whereas the operating cabin may be "Main cabin").

ProductSegment_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents the segment in a connection of a flight product.

commercialDescription.description: The commercial label describing the product.

Product_UpsellOfferV2.description: A product (eg: Extra legroom seat, Front section seat etc.), that can be bought along the ticket.

title.description: Title of the promotion in the language as specified in Content-Language header.

level.description: The value of the rating value of the (eg: 1, 2, 3, 4, or 5 for a 5-stars rating).

count.description: The number of customers who gave this rating.

RatingCategory_UpsellOfferV2.description: The rating category. There is one category per possible rating value (5 categories, from 1 to 5 for a 5-stars rating).

ratingCategories.description: The amount of ratings per level. Starts with the 5 stars.

averageRating.description: The average rating given by the former passengers.

RatingStatistics_UpsellOfferV2.description: The rating given by former customers to a flight.

availableCommercialCabinsPerConnections.description: A list of available commercial cabins.

items.description: A list of available commercial cabins.

arrivalDateTime.description: The arrival date and time of the segment.

departureDateTime.description: The departure date and time of the segment.

stopsAt.description: The list of technical stops occurring on the segment. These stops are usually for refuelling purpose and passengers usually do not disembark the plane (as opposed to transfers).

stopInformationText.description: The label linked to the technical stop. This message is translated.
stopInformationText.example: Your Muscat - Amsterdam trip includes a stop in Dammam / Dhahran, Saudi Arabia. Please check the entry requirements for this country.

transferTime.description: The transfer time between the arrival of this segment and the departure of the next segment, can be null if there is no next segment.

transferLabel.description: The label linked to the transfer. This message is translated.
transferLabel.example: Your trip includes a transfer in Paris. Please note that you must collect any checked baggage from Paris Orly Airport before proceeding to Paris Charles de Gaulle Airport.

highestPriority.description: A flag indicating if this segment is the one of higher priority, in regard to its haul type.

dateVariation.description: The number of days between the dates of departure and arrival of the segment.

flightDuration.description: The duration of the flight in minutes on this segment.

overnightLabel.description: The label accompanying the overnight flag. The label is translated.
overnightLabel.example: Your Copenhagen - Lisbon trip includes a stop in Amsterdam which may require an overnight stay at your own expense. Please check the entry requirements for this country.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from an airline point of view.

operatingCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from the point of view of the operating carrier (example for a bus: the commercial cabin may be described as economy, whereas the operating cabin may be "Main cabin").

StationCity_UpsellOfferV2.description: Represents a station (city, stopover etc.) that can be used in an itinerary.

code.description: Code of the surcharge (can be used to indicate if it's a booking fee).

itineraries.description: The list of itineraries matching the request.

arrivalDate.description: Date of arrival of the connection flight.

fareFamilyHierarchy.description: The fare family hierarchy of the connection.

estimatedFlightTime.description: The estimated flight time in minutes.

toChange.description: A flag to specify if the connection must be kept or changed. Only in rebooking or upgrade.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

id.description: The id identifying the passenger uniquely in the request.

pnrId.description: The id of the PNR (Passenger Name Record), identifying the reservation of the passenger. Only to be set in rebooking.

minAge.description: A lower bound for the age of the passenger (used to estimate the type of the passenger).

maxAge.description: An higher bound for the age of the passenger (used to estimate the type of the passenger).

ticketNumber.description: The ticket number of the passenger in the PNR. Only to be set in rebooking.

Passenger_FareV2.description: The requested passenger of a flight.

arrivalDateTime.description: The arrival date and time of the segment. It is specified as local time at destination of the segment.

departureDateTime.description: The departure date and time of the segment. It is specified as local time at origin of the segment.

operatingCarrier.description: The operating carrier (i.e. the carrier actually carrying the passengers, operated by the operating airline). It can be different than the Marketing carrier (carrier selling the flight).

marketingCarrier.description: The marketing carrier (i.e. the carrier selling the flight), it can be different than the operating carrier (i.e. the carrier actually carrying the passengers).

suffix.description: A suffix to be appended at the end of the flight number, for example when a flight is canceled and rescheduled.

sellingClass.description: The selling class (also called booking class) applicable to the segment.

equipmentType.description: The equipment type used to carry the passengers.

dateVariation.description: The number of days between the dates of departure and arrival of the segment.

SegmentRequest_FareV2.description: Represents a requested segment of a connection.

Stopover_FareV2.description: The destination location of the segment.

passengerId.description: The ID of the associated passenger in the request.

travelerKey.description: The key used to retrieve the traveler details from the persistance layer.

travelerSource.description: Represents the source from which a travel companion can come from.

TravelCompanion_FareV2.description: Represents a travel companion who is a potential traveler, registered as part of the logged in customer's inner circle (can be a member of a corporate contract, a friend, a family member, etc.)

description.example: origin city must be different from destination city AND neither or both O&D can be null at the same time

errorInInputPath.description: The path to the input element that raised the error/warning.

errorInOutputPath.description: The path to the output element that raised the error/warning.

requestContextId.description: The id of the request to be able to find more elements in the logs about the incident.

items.description: The type of errors.

AbnormalResponseDescriptor_FareV2.description: Represents the descriptor of a warning or error incident.

City_FareV2.description: The location code of the station.

code.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

label.description: The label describing the commercial cabin. The label is translated.

CommercialCabin_FareV2.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accomodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

departureDate.description: Departure date of the trip.

duration.description: The duration in minutes of the trip.

ConnectionResponse_FareV2.description: Represents the connection of an itinerary. It focuses only on the geographical and temporal data of the trip and does not contain fare or price related information.

marketRedirectText.description: Contextual message about a dynamic change in market.
marketRedirectText.example: Because of the country or region of departure you have chosen Germany, all prices will be shown in EUR.

displayPriceText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the price to display.
displayPriceText.example: All amounts are in EUR. Taxes and surcharges are included. No booking fee is applicable, but a payment surcharge may apply. Prices shown may vary depending on fare availability.

totalPriceText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the total price.
totalPriceText.example: All amounts are in EUR. Taxes and surcharges are included. No booking fee is applicable, but a payment surcharge may apply. Prices shown may vary depending on fare availability.

fareMilesText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the fare in miles.
fareMilesText.example: * Please note: airport taxes and security charges are not covered by your Miles and must be paid separately. The same applies for carrier-imposed surcharges. For flights within Europe operated by Air France, KLM, HOP! and Joon, no additional carrier-imposed surcharges apply. The exact cost will be shown in the trip overview after you have selected your flight.

handBaggageText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the hand baggages.
handBaggageText.example: * Applies to flights operated by KLM and Air France.

flexibilityText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the flexibility conditions related to the flight.
flexibilityText.example: ** Refundable in form of a voucher if you cancel before the 1st flight in your trip. Voucher is valid for 1 year from the date of issue, non-refundable and non-transferable.

optionalUMText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the flexibility conditions related to the optional Unaccompanied Minors.
optionalUMText.example: The Kids Solo service will be automatically added to your booking at the Options step. Its price is not included in the fares below.

infantAttributesSpecificitiesText.description: The legal disclaimer linked to the specificities related to the infants.
infantAttributesSpecificitiesText.example: Baggage allowance and other fare conditions may vary for infant passengers. Please check applicable conditions.

Disclaimer_FareV2.description: The texts to be shown as legal disclaimers regarding fare, tax, fee, baggages etc.

text.description: The text displayed for environmental information

passengers.description: List of passengers associated to the product (matching requested passenger list).

calculationTimestamp.description: The date and time at which the data related to this product have been calculated by the providing service.

type.description: The different periods of time that can be considered when requesting lowest fares.

FlightProduct_FareV2.description: Represents a flight product offer. It contains all the data related to the fare.

co2CompensationText.description: Contextual information related to the CO2 compensation of the flight.
co2CompensationText.example: Fly green: Air France flights in metropolitan France are now 100% carbon neutral.

travelCorridorText.description: Contextual information related to the travel corridor program.
travelCorridorText.example: We offer quarantine-free travel to Singapore on selected Air France flights for fully vaccinated passengers, as part of Singapores Vaccinated Travel Lane (VTL) initiative. To board these designated VTL flights, please ensure you meet all the VTL requirements. These flights are labeled as a VTL flight

flightProducts.description: The list of possible flight offers for this itinerary.

locationSpecificRemarks.description: A list of remarks specific to the locations constituting the itinerary.

connections.description: The list of connections constituting the itinerary.

remarkCode.description: The code associated with the remark.

remarkText.description: The label of the remark translated in the language specified in Content-Language header.
remarkText.example: You must obtain authorization online for all travels to, from, or through the United States. This measure applies to residents of all countries in the Visa Waiver Program (VWP).

LocationSpecificRemark_FareV2.description: Represents a remark specific to the locations constituting an itinerary.

itineraries.description: The list of itineraries matching the request.

fare.description: The fare price as applicable for the passenger type.

taxes.description: The taxes price as applicable for the passenger type.

products.description: The products price as applicable for the passenger type.

surcharges.description: Surcharges applicable per passenger. Conditional: surcharge applies to either a passenger or a PNR..

price.description: The price as applicable for the passenger type.

penalty.description: The penalty price as applicable for the passenger type. Only applies to rebooking a ticket.

primaryPax.description: The flag to indicate if the passenger type this price applies to is the primary pax type.

fare.description: The fare price as applicable for the passenger.

taxes.description: The taxes price as applicable for the passenger.

products.description: The products price as applicable for the passenger type.

surcharges.description: Surcharges applicable per passenger. Conditional: surcharge applies to either a passenger or a PNR..

price.description: The price as applicable for the passenger.

penalty.description: The penalty price as applicable for the passenger. Only applies to rebooking a ticket.

displayPrice.description: The display price for the product. Computed for all the passengers and based on the consumer need (could be rounded up for instance).

adjustedDisplayPrice.description: The adjusted display price for the product. Computed for all the passengers and based on the consumer need (could be rounded up for instance).

totalPrice.description: The total price for the product. Computed for all the passengers.

adjustedTotalPrice.description: The adjusted total price for the product. Computed for all the passengers.

surcharges.description: List of additional charges applied to an offer.

pricePerPassengerTypes.description: The individual prices grouped by passenger types.

dynamicWaiver.description: Flag to indicate if a dynamic penalty waiver applies. The Dynamic Waiver is a commercial gesture which is used in case of "abnormal" operations (strike, meteorological conditions) in voluntary rebooking, and/or when the flight booked by the customer has been canceled (involuntary rebooking) etc.This waiver exempts the customer from paying the penalty fee or/and fare difference that normally apply in voluntary rebooking. Only applies when rebooking a ticket.

flexibilityWaiver.description: Flag to indicate if a flexible penalty waiver applies. Only applies to rebooking a ticket.

currency.description: The currency used for the fee. Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217.

displayType.description: The type of price displayed. Indicates what is included in the price displayed (only the fare, or also the fees and taxes).

numberOfSeatsAvailable.description: The number of seats available on this connection.

negotiatedFare.description: Flag indicating if the fare is a negotiated one, in case of corporate booking flow.

segments.description: The list of segments making part of the connection.

products.description: The list of products (eg: SAF) the passenger will have access to on this connection.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin.

continuousPricing.description: The flag to indicate if continuous pricing is applied to the fare.

ProductConnection_FareV2.description: Represents the connection of a flight product.

cabinClassCode.description: The code (eg: M, W, C etc.) of the cabin class (eg: economy, business, first etc.) in which the passenger will travel on this segment. It represents the quality of accomodation & services the passenger will have access to in the airplane.

sellingClassCode.description: The selling class code (also called booking class) of the segment. It is a further (invisible) division of the cabin class that details the different conditions and benefits offered among a same cabin class. The selling class code usually is the first letter of the fare basis code.

fareBasisCode.description: The fare basis applicable to the segment. It represents a fare basis which is a alphabetic or alpha-numeric code used to identify a fare type and the rules applicable to that fare.

products.description: The list of products (eg: Extra legroom seat) the passenger will have access to on this segment.

commercialCabin.description: The commercial cabin represents the different qualities of accommodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

commercialCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from an airline point of view.

operatingCabinLabel.description: The label describing the commercial cabin applicable on this segment from the point of view of the operating carrier (example for a bus: the commercial cabin may be described as economy, whereas the operating cabin may be "Main cabin").

ProductSegment_FareV2.description: Represents the segment in a connection of a flight product.

commercialDescription.description: The commercial label describing the product.

Product_FareV2.description: A product (eg: Extra legroom seat, Front section seat etc.), that can be bought along the ticket.

title.description: Title of the promotion in the language as specified in Content-Language header.

availableCommercialCabinsPerConnections.description: A list of available commercial cabins.

items.description: A list of available commercial cabins.

StationCity_FareV2.description: Represents a station (city, stopover etc.) that can be used in an itinerary.

StationGroup_FareV2.description: Represents a group of a stopover and city.

StationStopover_FareV2.description: Represents a station (city, stopover etc.) that can be used in an itinerary.

code.description: Code of the surcharge (can be used to indicate if it's a booking fee).

bookingFlow.description: Represents a type of booking flow, i.e. the specific context in which the customer is booking a flight (eg: for leisure, as a corporate, as a staff etc.).

passengers.description: The list of passengers for which the offers are requested.

commercialCabins.description: The commercial cabins accepted for the offers requested. The commercial cabin has an impact on the quality of accomodation & services and the price of the offers returned.

items.description: Represents the possible commercial cabins, including the "ALL" option. Commercial cabins represent the different qualities of accomodation available on the flight, higher classes being more comfortable and typically more expensive. It usually corresponds to different sections in the aircraft (first class at the front of the plane).

withUpsellCabins.description: The boolean indicates whether or not the upsell cabins should be included.

departureDate.description: Date of departure of the connection flight.

additionalProperties.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

passengerCount.description: The specification of the passengers for which the offers are requested.

currency.description: The currency used for prices in response.  Three letter currency code according to ISO 4217.

reservationId.description: Id of the reservation. Only in case of rebooking, or upgrade.

fareOption.description: The different options to target a specific fare.

negotiatedFareOnly.description: A flag to request only negotiated fares (and not public ones), in corporate businessFlow.

officeId.description:
An id identifying the initiator of the request. An office ID can for example identify an office (eg: airlines, travel agencies, hotel proividers etc.), an agent, a terminal.
It is built based on a hierarchical structure constituted of a location code, a corporate Id (identifying a group office) and an office code.
Depending on the ID provided, specific processes might occur and dedicated data structures might be used.

focusedConnection.description: The index to the connection to retrieve (starting from 0), 0 for the outbound, 1 for the inbound

displayPriceContent.description: The different formats and content for the displayPrice value.

shortest.description: Indicates whether shortest route should be found and favoured. Otherwise lowest fare is found. This option is valid ONLY when the "booking flow" is not set or set to"Leisure".

lowestFareCombination.description: The boolean indicates whether or not the flight for each bound should be selected with the lowest price

includeCarriers.description: The carriers that should be used in the offers requested.

items.description: The carriers that should be used in the offers requested.

fixCalendarSize.description: The size of the calendar in days.

fallbackMode.description: The fallback mode of the filtering process.
